content.description: Climb unprotected for a few feet to get up on the ledge then climb the cool pocketed face to the anchors. The boulders on top look pretty sketchy but they're solid.
content.protection: 4 Bolts/2 Bolt Anchor

content.description: a relatively newer addition to shepherds, crux comes right below the chains.
content.protection: bolts / 2 large Metolious rap hangers. not suitable for lowering
content.location: the first route after you squeeze past the pyramid boulder

content.description: a trad climb that rivals "biscuits & jam". start in a small hand-sized crack, get to the ledge, and then trend up and right to where the crack continues above the ledge.
content.protection: SR / 2 large bolt anchor. not suitable for lowering
content.location: the right crack of the obvious dihedral, right of "Shepherds Arete"

content.description: closed project. red tag
content.protection: bolts / 2 bolt anchor w/ rings
content.location: starts in an obvious corner system to the left of "Stump Route". seems to be a continuation of the start of "The Johnson Variation" of the fisherman.

content.description: Unknown grade or FA. Looks very fun on beautiful orange stone
content.protection: bolts / 2 bolt anchor w/ rings
content.location: 2 lines over from the fisherman

content.description: Unknown grade or FA. Looks very fun on beautiful orange stone
content.protection: bolts / 2 bolt anchor w/ rings
content.location: Bolted line to the immediate right of "the Fisherman"

content.description: unknown closed project. red tag
content.protection: bolts / 2 bolt anchor w/ rings
content.location: immediate bolt line to the left of FLOJO

content.description: Unknow grade or if completed. One long perma-draw hanging from the roof
content.protection: bolts / bolt anchor
content.location: Bolt line to the right of "Apes Shall not Kill Apes"

content.description: Start on slabby climbing to ledge then pull crux mantle and go for the anchors. A nasty fall can occur if you botch the mantle move.
content.protection: bolts/anchors
content.location: To the left of Birthday Route

content.description: A little tree grows out of a the base of this dihedral. Get a couple of small pieces in and layback the short 5.8 crux2/3 of the way up and either traverse right to 'Return of Angst' anchors or rap of tree.
content.protection: SR. Mostly small gear. Tree Anchor
content.location: The corner to the right of an orange face and left of the arete route Return of Angst.

climbs.name: Tangled Roots can Clog yer Pipes

content.description: Detached boulder on the right side of the crag.  short powerful sequential and not half bad
content.protection: bolts / 2 large Metolious rap hangers. not suitable for lowering

content.description: This is THE classic 5.12 route at Shepherd Springs. This route tests your skills as a climber with tricky crimp sequences, delicate traverses, powerful deadpoint moves and improbable and slippery jammy jams. A wild ride and a route well worth doing.
content.protection: Bolts / 2 bolt anchor w/ rap rings
content.location: Trail takes you right up to the base of the wall. Stump Route goes up middle of the face to a flared crack at the roof.

content.description: unknow if completed. Grade Unknown. Marked as an open project in Cole Fennel Book.
content.protection: Bolts / 2 large metolious rap hangers. not suitable for lower
content.location: Far-right arete of "Apes" wall

content.description: a hidden trad gem in the dihedral to the right of "Shepherds Arete"
content.protection: SR / 2 large bolt anchor. not suitable for lowering
content.location: dihedral to the right of "Shepherds Arete"

content.description: Start close to the arete on hard moves to get over the bulge. Once above the bulge move on easier climbing to big ledge for rest if needed and then on to hard upper crux.
content.protection: bolts / 2 large Metolious rap hangers. not suitable for lowering
content.location: To the left of Bottom Feeder on the arete

content.description: This is a classic for the area. This is the prominent arete and you come to after climbing the main trail to the bluff line. Struggle up the first 3 bolts on hard 5.10 climbing to a marginal rest. Pull another couple of hard moves to a big ledge before the final crux move leading to the anchors.
content.protection: Bolts / 2 bolt anchor w/ rap rings
content.location: 1st bolted line you see when you reach the bluffline from the trail.

content.description: one of the harder lines at Shepherds
content.protection: bolts / 2 large metolious rap anchors. not suitable for lowering
content.location: immediately left of "Shepherds Arete"

content.description: Black and Orange Streaked Face with a Small Roof
content.protection: 5 Bolts/2 Bolt Anchor
content.location: Main Bluff line

content.description: its got everything from chimney to fingers, needs cleaning
content.protection: SR / tree anchor
content.location: around left corner of "meat peddler"

content.description: Follow the opening face moves into an alcove, don't get sucked in too far though. Make a balancy move to another bolt prior to a second crux below the anchor.
content.protection: bolts / 2 large Metolious rap hangers. not suitable for lowering
content.location: Far right side of the crag just down hill from 'Tree-in-Crack'

content.description: n/a
content.protection: 6 bolts / 2 large metolious hangers. not suitable for lowering
content.location: 20ft to the right of "flary disappointed". Identify by honeycomb rock after first 2 bolts

content.description: Stick clip the first bolt above the low roof with  deep sandstone pockets and bust over to mossy slopers and surmount the ledge. Easier face climbing leads into a blank face above a horizontal crack to anchors. Very mossy and dirty route.
content.protection: 6 bolts. Bolt anchor.
content.location: On the wall right of Chad's Pile O Rubble Chimney. This is the route right of Albatross.

content.description: Make sure your belayer is paying attention with the 2 bolts off the ledge. possible ledge fall with a bad catch
content.protection: 5 bolts / 2 bolt anchor w/ rings
content.location: 2 bolted lines to the left of large crack "big mac"

content.description: A V3'ish boulder problem start gets you off the ground. Move up easy climbing to shelf below roof/crack. Pull hard moves on crimps to gain flaring crack and pull through crack to anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2 anchors with rap rings on top of the bluff.
content.location: This is the 1st climb on the far left side of the main bluff.

content.description: fun lower face climbing that leads to a dirty top-out. needs cleaning
content.protection: 5 bolts / 2 bolt anchor w/ rings
content.location: right of "meat peddler"

content.description: a variation start to "the fisherman" that avoids the majority of the wide variation. Start in the crack system to the right of the fisherman, climb about 25 ft until you hit the obvious traversing crack, and climb left to join the top of the fisherman. Extend all of your lower pieces/bolts to avoid heinous rope dragthis route used to be rated R but with the addition of bolts (on unknown # 6 closed project) it makes the climb into a more enjoyable mixed climb.
content.protection: Standard rack / bolts / 2 bolt anchor w/ rings

content.description: Hard start to easy climbing before hitting crux move under roof.
content.protection: 4 bolts. 2 large metolius rap hangers (not suitable for lower)
content.location: 4th Bolted route on the far left side of the main bluff.

content.description: a fun varied climb, a few pockets and small edges
content.protection: bolts / 2 large Metolious rap hangers. not suitable for lowering
content.location: left side of overhanging arete 20 ft to the right of Shepherds arete

content.description: Unfinished open project. grade unknown, most likely harder than 'Heartbreaker"
content.protection: 6 bolts / 2 large rap hangers. not suitable for lowering
content.location: variation of "Heartbbreaker"

content.description: an underappreciated classic on a beautiful blank face
content.protection: 5 bolts / 2 large metolious hangers. not suitable for lowering
content.location: left of FLOJO on large blank gray face

content.description: Easy climbing up to somewhat pumpy (for the grade) moves to get to the anchors
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2 large metolius rap hangers.
content.location: 3rd route on the far left side of the main bluff

content.description: Called a "must-do" in the guide. A couple slab moves get you going off the ground, lead through crimps and small ledges to a small dihedral feature and a reachy, no-feet crux to anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolt. 2 large metolius hangers.
content.location: Located just uphill right of Needs a nut and left of Tree in Crack dihedral.

content.description: Thin moves define this climb. Start on crimpy climbing to easier terrain before heading into the steep climbing up top. Slabby-thin moves gets you to the anchors. Good footwork is a plus on this one.
content.protection: Bolts/Anchors
content.location: This route is in the middle of the bluff to the left of Brown Sugar

content.description: low crux leads to an enjoyable arete
content.protection: 7 bolts / 2 large Metolious rap hangers. no suitable for lowering
content.location: left most route on grey blank face

content.description: A must-do for anyone interested in off-width climbing. Start on the obviously low angle crack that quickly becomes more challenging as you approach the base of the roof. Work your way out to the exit of the roof and throw some challenging jams that would make the Wide Boyz proud. Continue battling the crack past a small ledge to the bolted anchor.
content.protection: Standard rack plus a #5. 2 bolt ring anchor
content.location: 20 ft to the right of "The American"

content.description: This wide crack is named after the person who discovered Shepherd Springs. Chimney moves along with a layback get you into another wide section of chimney with options for small gear available. Either plug a #7 Camalot deep inside or trust the sparse pro and do everything you possibly can to wiggle up beneath the crux overhang. Work an arm-bar jam up high and hit an obvious jug, battle the pump and bump through good holds to the anchors.
content.protection: SR. up to #6 / Optional #7 Camalot or #4 Big Bro. Bolt anchor w/ rings
content.location: Offwidth wideness right of Biscuits and Jam and left of Shepherd's Arete.

content.description: Start in dihedral using stemming, liebacking, or drop stepping (crux).  Second crux between second and third bolt - smear on left face and use left hand side pull.  Straightforward to ledge, then a moderate move to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts + Ring Anchors
content.location: This is to the right of Bootlegger.  It is the third bolted route to the right of Rage.  Start in dihedral.

content.description: cool moves on a unique feature on the far right end of the crag
content.protection: bolts / Anchor bolts are located about 2 or 3 feet back from the lip on the top of the formation. The leader will either have to belay from above or bring cordage to build an anchor that extends over the edge.
content.location: far right end of the crag

content.description: Begin with a challenging overhung crack / layback start, shimmy up an easy unprotected (unless you want to bring big bros) chimney. Then stick yourself into the flared off-width that eats Chicken Wings and has the occasional face hold.
content.protection: .4 - #5 (could maybe get away with a #4) cruxes are easily protected. Tree Anchor, could possibly traverse to "The American" anchor
content.location: The crack just to the left "The American"

content.description: A bouldery start on big holds reaches a high 1st bolt (spotter/stick clip recommended). Keep it together for a relatively easy runout to the second bolt. Then move left and finish through the middle of the roof on good holds.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2 large metolius rap hangers. Extended draws will help avoid rope drag.
content.location: 5th Bolted route on the left side of the bluff line.

content.description: large blocky corner in between "bottom feeder" and "albatross"
content.protection: Standard Rack / tree anchor
content.location: large blocky corner in between "bottom feeder" and "albatross"

content.description: extremely dirt dihedral to the left of "biscuits & jam"
content.protection: SR / 2 large rap bolt anchor
content.location: left of "biscuits & jam"

content.description: Climb up sustained climbing through 3 or 4 bolts to a half-ass rest before the real crux-a bouldery move - then on to more sustained climbing to anchors. - Groundfall possible if 2nd clip is missed.
content.protection: bolts / 2 large Metolious rap hangers. not suitable for lowering
content.location: Near a dihedral to the right of Shep's Arete.

climbs.name: Bootlegger
climbs.fa: John Ryan, David Deville 6/13/13 with Sunner Donis

content.description: Straight up to small roof, trend left over roof (crux), and easy runout to anchors.  Shares anchors with The Return of Angst.
content.protection: 5 bolts + ring anchors
content.location: To the right of The Return of Angst.  Second bolted route to the right of Rage.

content.description: Start off climbing a short face and move into the wide crack. After cleaning out the spider-webs throw some pro above you and pull hard moves to move out of the roof crack. Once abve the roof use the crack or a few face hold to go for the anchors.
content.protection: Standard gear up to #4 anchors are not suitable for lowering
content.location: The obvious crack to the right of Brown Sugar-about the middle of the bluff.

content.description: awesome trad climb that is well worth your time. needs cleaning
content.protection: SR + #5 (optional doubles of #3-#5) / 2 bolt anchor w/ rings
content.location: right of "ledge dweller"

content.description: Climb up to a small ledge and pull a small bulge and finish to the anchors.
content.protection: Bolts/Anchors
content.location: This is the farthest route to the far right side of the bluff

content.description: Open project out of a huge roof area on the far left side of the bluff. You can't miss this one. 5.13???
content.protection: Bolts/anchors
content.location: Far left side under huge roof-you cant miss it.

content.description: A bouldery start leads past a bolt. Once on top of the little bulge a 2nd bolt is before a thin crack secton. Placement of pro in this small crack is needed to prevent groundfall. Move through this crack to 3rd bolt under a tiny roof/bulge.  After clipping the 3rd bolt move through cruxy section onto 4th bolt on sustained face climbing to anchors. Somewhat runout after last bolt to anchors and sustained the entire way makes a tough and great climb!!
content.protection: Mixed / 4 bolts, gear .3 - .75 & stoppers / 2 bolt anchors
content.location: This route is just down from a small climb down of rocks before you reach Spermalita.  Left side of bluff line

content.description: climb "wrestling with an alligator" to the ledge then bump left to "Steele crossing"
content.protection: bolts / 2 large metolious rap anchors. not suitable for lowering
content.location: same start as "Wrestling with an alligator"

content.description: thuggy opening moves leads to enjoyable face climbing
content.protection: bolts / 2 large Metolious rap hangers. not suitable for lowering
content.location: right of "chads pile-o-rubble"

content.description: Pretty tough boulder start to the first bolt or stick-clip. Climb featured, vertical rock through a roof that is bigger than it appears from the ground.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 2 large metolius rap hangers
content.location: The first route right of the steep gully that separates 'Wrestling with Gators' and this route.

content.description: The guidebook lists it as a 5.9+ but the start I think is harder closer to a 5.10a/b. There's a cheater block you can use to make it a little easier to start, but its fun to hit the hanging start.
content.protection: 5 bolts/2 bolt anchor

content.description: This is the main bluffline. It is covered by big trees so it is always shady and this place sees little traffic despite the quality of climbs here.
